title: Scientific Inquiry-Based Learn-by-Doing (LBD) Online Training Course for Engineering Practical Competencies

context.prior_knowledge: Expert-level engineering knowledge, experience in solving complex problems, and understanding of basic scientific inquiry methods (experimental design, data analysis)
context.additional_context: Program for practicing engineers focusing on integrating 21st-century competencies (collaboration, problem-solving, digital literacy) into engineering practice. Ensured accessibility and practicality through smartphone-based learning. Systematic application of scientific methodologies (observation, hypothesis testing, variable control) to engineering problem-solving processes.

learning_goals: Learners can perform at least three projects by analyzing variables of real-world engineering problems and applying the scientific inquiry process using the LBD instructional method
Learners develop the competency to systematically measure and analyze experimental data while completing design tasks in real-time with team members using online collaboration tools
Learners can write a self-reflection report that evaluates 21st-century competencies required for engineering practice while formulating hypotheses and deriving evidence-based conclusions

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
